sa723:1.2: One time, the Buddha was staying at Anāthapiṇḍada Park in Jeta Grove in Śrāvastī.
sa723:2.1: It was then that the Bhagavān addressed the monks,
sa723:2.2: “It’s good, monks, to rely on someone to hear the Dharma.
sa723:2.3: Junior monks are to support and serve the venerable elders.
sa723:2.5: From time to time, junior monks who support and serve elder monks can hear the profound and subtle Dharma.
sa723:2.6: After hearing the profound Dharma, they’ll achieve two ways of being correct: Correctness of body and correctness of mind.
sa723:3.1: “At that point, they’ll cultivate the awakening factor of mindfulness.
sa723:3.2: After cultivating the awakening factor of mindfulness, they’ll fulfill the awakening factor of mindfulness.
sa723:3.3: After fulfilling the awakening factor of mindfulness, they’ll discriminate qualities, discern qualities, and deliberate on qualities.
sa723:3.4: At that point, they’ll skillfully cultivate the awakening factor of discriminating qualities …
sa723:3.5: they’ll cultivate the fulfillment of the awakening factor of equanimity.”
sa723:4.1: After the Buddha taught this sutra, the monks who heard what he taught rejoiced and handed it down.
